Reviews.Title: “little rooms, everithing old and dusty”
Reviews.Author: Maria S
Reviews.Content: Hy, I was hosted by this hotel between 15-18 March. The location is verry good, but the rooms are quite small and dusty. We got a room at the street, we couldn't sleep because it was a lot of noise (traffic and also it is a construction renovation.It was like no window at all. It was also cold on nights because the door was shorter about 5 cm .....we put slippers on the dor... We ask the receptionist on evening before we leave, to call us a taxi in the next morning the day when we left the hotel and he book us a ....somme private car. I belive it was a friend of him. It has nothing to do with taxis, We ask a taxi and he said that if we want a taxi we must go on the street and do this service by ourself :?! We also verify on the internet the route (Susex Garden - Baker Green Line station, costs : 5-7 punds)....of course that ..driver took us 10 pounds ....obvioulsy he doesn"t have any tax machine...but at 5 am we haven"t the time to find a cab...... It was an unpleasent experience

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable but remember you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: babybray
Reviews.Content: Firstly the hotel is in a great location, perfect for paddington station and steady walks to the attraction and practically on the doorstep of the hop on bus service (big bus company). We had a 2 night stay for a family of 3 costing 190 inc breakfast - which really isnt upto much, thats the only downside as far as i could see especially since the stay was so cheap i dont expect 5 star all the way. We had a family room right next to reception which was clean and well fitted - the decor is on the old side but i dont plan on living in the place so we didnt mind and despite the fact we were very close to the main door we werent disturbed. So all in all a very enjoyable stay especially since we came to visit london not a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “my stay in London”
Reviews.Author: ALO2309 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, near Paddington Station and Underground. Some restaurants in the neighborhood and other shops. Room quite small. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “near to Paddington Station”
Reviews.Author: S H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is a well priced, simple, but good hotel. For us it's on on a well located place near to travel from Paddington Station by train to the Wet and taking the underground to London City. Some good pubs and lots of restaurants in the neighborhood. Tips: only the toiletpaper should be more sturdy

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, poor conditions”
Reviews.Author: Rosalyn W
Reviews.Content: I, actually, kind of enjoyed the stay here, although there is a lot more to desire. But first the pros: the location is super convenient - Hyde Park is right there, and the London Paddington rail station is just few minutes away. The staff was all friendly and helpful. There was some problem with the sink in our room and they were kind enough to move us to another (although smaller) room. It was warm inside, additional sheets were provided on request for no charge. So far, so good. BUT there are some cons: cleanliness... they should really think about hiring some housekeepers or something, cause, really, I've been to cheaper hostels and in comparison to Alexandra, they look like castles; WiFi wasn't available first 2 nights for some reason; Our room was facing the street, so it got pretty noisy inside early in the morning. Oh, and one more thing! We wandered for about 15 mins trying to find the hotel. Tripadvisor says it's at 10 Sussex Place, though the hotel's website says different.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location but not worth the pain. Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Dunnycan
Reviews.Content: Is in a prime location but the hotel itself is rubbish. The rooms are small and difficult to move around. The toilet is puny and for a normal sized male you need to open the door in order to stand up and sit down. The cleanliness of the room is questionable. The toilet seat had a hair stuck to it upon check in. The staff are all migrants and have a strong accent. One of the staff members working at the reception required the voucher for the last night and was very overbearing and was trying to get me to sign something instead of the voucher when I was searching for it in my bag. the cleaner was very rude when asking if we wanted our room cleaned and required us to leave the "straight away" in order to clean it and told us it would be 5, 10, 15 or 20 minutes. How can the duration of cleaning vary by up to 15 minutes? Furthermore, you have to make a Â£10 deposit in order to have a remote for your TV in your room and the menu for the TV is in Italian. The lift was broken during our stay and were told on the first day we checked in (new years day) that a contractor would be sent out to fix it after the public holiday. By the third day it still had not been fixed. We were placed on the fourth floor and were not asked if we required help to carry our suitcases to the fourth floor (the stairs twirl around as well). Was not particularly cheap. Not a pleasant experience and would definitely not recommend to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not so cheerful”
Reviews.Author: vixx83
Reviews.Content: Firstly - rooms are cheap, we booked ahead and paid about Â£60 per night for a double room. On arrival, we were put in a twin room, even though a double had be booked. We went back to reception and asked to be moved to a double but they could not accommodate this request. The room was tired looking, TV had no remote control and sheets were itchy. The bathroom was laughable - smaller than an airplane toilet and you could barely close the door when you used the loo. Breakfast was white toast with ham and processed cheese with watery orange juice and (warm) cheap yoghurts. Nothing hot to have except tea/coffee - you really need a bit more to warm you through in December in London! The only redeeming features are the price, which is cheap for London, and the location. Very handy being so close to Paddington and Hyde Park. However, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor rooms, poor breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: GlenrothesG
Reviews.Content: Took 1hr to check in. Not the hotels fault, booking agents. Travel Republic, avoid at all costs. Ended up having to pay again and claim back money from agent. Â£100 for family room, not bad as it should have been Â£200. Got family room but the decor and layout were bad. No remote for TV. Breakfast was toast with ham or processed cheese, cheap yoghurt, orange squash and bad instant coffee. At least I was only there for one night. Positive was receptionist was as helpful as he could be.

Reviews.Title: “Well below the mark”
Reviews.Author: Niels_Jansen30
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice location, close to Paddington station and it is not expensive. and...well..that is all the positive that can be said about it. Normally I try to be positive but here , unfortunately, this is impossible. Many rooms cannot be reached by elevator. We had to climb up and down a lot of stairs. The room was tiny and completely outdated. No isolation so lots of noice from the street. Even worse, no heating in november. Stairs were filthy, dust everywhere. Bathroom same size and facilities as in an airplane. Breakfast: a little bit of toast, jam and ham. Staff unhelpfull and clearly unhappy with their job. Very surprised that this hotel received 3 stars from the english tourist board...in continental Europe it would get no more than 1 star. London is a great town but next time we will definitely chose another place.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: JamesandDebbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in this hotel. The rooms are perfect value. They were very homely, although quite small. Perfect location! Just a short walk to Paddington Station and to the main sights of London. Buses also stop frequently down the road from this hotel. Breakfast wasn't great - cold toast, minimal choice of cereal, choice of 3 yoghurts. Overall it is great value for money as it is a cheap price to stay in London!

Reviews.Title: “For Lack of Better Choices”
Reviews.Author: pige_paa_ferie
Reviews.Content: There is one plus to this hotel. Location. It's 5 minutes walk from Paddington Station, located on a very charming street. Apart from the location, I was disappointed due to the following:- 1. Very low value for money. We paid GBP200 per room per night. Other hotels were fully booked so we had no choice. For GBP200, I got the following:- One smelly room. My room had a bad smell. Same for the bed sheets. The hotel is very old. One uncleaned bathroom with poor lighting. Very basic breakfast - Think white bread you toast yourself, cordial juice, instant coffee, boiled eggs and cornflakes. No free wi-fi. As I was handing my keys to the reception, I overheard that another occupant had returned and found his belongings stolen. The reception asked him to make a police report. If you have a choice, don't go here.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for the location”
Reviews.Author: DAS55IL
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in this hotel and everything was OK . We had pre-booked a double room and a triple room three months before, but we weren't satisfied with the rooms they gave us when we arrived. The guy at the desk was very helpful and gave us other rooms.The beds were very comfortable, the linen and the towels were very clean and the room service changed them every day, the shower was hot and powerful, the Tv was OK ( no problem that we had to pay 10 pounds deposit for the remote control). So....no bugs, no flies, no danger for our belongings...The neighbourhood was excellent. Our only complaint was breakfast, which was basic and repetitive, that's why we sometimes skipped it. The location was the big advantage, so we would definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Was Ok”
Reviews.Author: Blackpoooollll
Reviews.Content: no fry ups in the morning. Staff was ok but couldn't help much due to language barrier. Location was perfect as we were going to Egware Road, quick walk and you are on edgware road. Happy over all. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahrowe99
Reviews.Content: Booked the room for an event at Hyde Park. The room was very very small, 1 window opening out to a quad of sort looking into 4 other rooms. The drain pipes from the rooms above ran through our room which made for a constant annoying noise! The room door was thin and poorly fitting along with the bathroom door which didn't actually close!! Our friends had a room 2 doors down and their bathroom looked like a wardrobe! You stepped up into it and it was the size of a shower cubical! They could use the toilet, brush their teeth and shower all at the same time!! The noise at night was awful from within the hotel. All the fire doors along the corridor slammed shut each time someone passed through so with the "thin" room door you may had well of sleep in the corridor! Breakfast was interesting!! Basic range yogurts and cereals, toast available and self serve drinks. Overall book if you're tight on budget or for location. I'll never go back if I can help it!!

Reviews.Title: “"No Frills"”
Reviews.Author: lyank
Reviews.Content: We were here for three nights, staff were friendly and helpful, the room was just enough for 3 fully figure beauties and our laugage, once we organized it a bit, with 3 single beds, was at street level with a planter box so the window was wide open when we were in, the shower with a small basin is the smallest ever when you sat on the loo your knee's come up against the door, so when you were by yourself the door could be left open for some comfort, ha ha but was really clean, it was ok, as when you're on holidays "go with the flow I say" a continental breakie awaited you in the morning. Other than that up the road Paddington metro hop-on hop-off Big Bus tour restraunts shops Sawyer Arms for a couple of coldies and the best fish n chips in town are all at a few minutes walk ....excellent fun stay for where it is ....enjoyed London....

Reviews.Title: “not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: highcloud1943
Reviews.Content: The description Hotel is completely misleading for the Alexandra hotel, the room was in a converted basement lacking light and air, the room and the whole basement stank, there were dead bugs and flies lying on the staircase, the room was in a poor state of disrepair with things like the bathroom door handle hanging by one screw to the door, I requested from the front desk that if it was available something better and was told by the management that they did not have anything better, and they did not seem to concerned about my complaints, I suspect they have had many more about their rooms before me I had already paid for this room through hotwire.com so I had a choice stay there or find something else , I found something else, In conclusion I would certainly not recommend this hotel to anybody who is considering staying in the London area of the United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Adequate at Good location”
Reviews.Author: GT1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here. Hotel is perfectly located, near Paddington station, about 3 minute walk and plenty of shops and restaurants around. The room was in the secondary building (No 10 building) and was a single room and for a one night stay was quite good. The bed had a slight lean on the mattress (could do to switch the mattress over), and the room was clean and spacious enough. The show is quite small and could be hard to handle if you are big size or not used to that type (coming from Japan it is fine for me, I am used to that). Didnt know about the remote control on the TV, there was none, sojust used the buttons on the Tv, not that i was there to enjoy long nights in front of the TV anyway. Breakfast is pretty ordinary, better off to go to the restaturants up the road, they are relavatively cheap. If you dont go with high expectations you'll be happy as location is great and the price is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Anywhere else is better!”
Reviews.Author: Vilbeler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Alexandra can best be summarized by saying that our happiest moment during these few hours was the moment of our departure! The best you can say about this place is that it is located in a great neighbourhood with lots of hotels, shops and restaurants nearby, and within walking distance to Paddington Station (very convenient for the trains to Heathrow Airport). But thatâ€™s about it. When checking in at about 2pm, we asked the young man at the reception if they had given us a quiet room as we had requested in our reservation. He said, he wasnâ€™t sure but the room â€œshould be quietâ€�. When we arrived at the room, we noticed two things: firstly, the receptionist had lied to us as the room was facing the main street and not quiet at all. Secondly, and far more unpleasant, the room hadnâ€™t been cleaned yet and was still dirty from its former inhabitant. Really gross! In my opinion, this is an absolute no-go! This is the 21st century after all, and some form of communication between the chambermaids and the reception should be possible! And we werenâ€™t the only guests with this problem! When we returned to the reception to ask for another room, we met some people again, whom we had seen upon arrival and they all had the same problem, too! The rooms they wanted to give us as an alternative were not acceptable, either, so we decided to just drop our luggage in the first, still dirty room, and head out for London instead! The unpleasant discoveries about this hotel continued upon our return to this place later in the evening: as none of us had ever seen such a filthy bathroom! Although we were yearning for a shower, a closer inspection of the mouldy shower curtain and the scale-infested shower head convinced us otherwise! The toilet brush was beyond words! We were all very disgusted with this bathroom and tried to touch as little as possible (which was made easy by the fact that there was virtually no shelf or anything where you could put your toiletries). The water tap in the washing-basin was also full of limescale! The entire bathroom was a serious risk to your health! Breakfast held more very unpleasant surprises. Iâ€™m still not sure what the â€œorange waterâ€� was meant to be. Anyway, it was disgusting, as was the rest of the â€œbreakfastâ€�. The cheese and ham didnâ€™t look very fresh, every time you needed something you had to get up and get it. Hereâ€™s an idea: just put a small tablecloth on every table, with plates, cups and cutlery â€“ and teach your people what â€œcleaning a roomâ€� actually meansâ€�! We definitely wonâ€™t stay at this horrible place again and cannot recommend it to anyone else either! Donâ€™t know if it has anything to do with it, but my companion has a huge cold sore now (maybe caused by her extreme disgust about the filthy bathroom and disastrous hygienic conditions at this place).

Reviews.Title: “No security”
Reviews.Author: Eric123_11
Reviews.Content: If you have any concerns about your safety or the security of your belongings, stay away from this hotel. Our room was burgled along with some five other rooms. It is very easy to break in using a simple tool. I could tell by looking at the marks on the door that this was not the first time the room was illegally entered. Being robbed was bad enough but the attitude of the hotel management was "too bad so sad" They offered me nothing except a shrug. Like all London hotel rooms this was small with the entire bathroom in a closet. Stay away from this place

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: kathleen036
Reviews.Content: Originaly booked Seymour - put in Berkley court - room flooded same evening - moved down road to Alexandra. 3 of us put into basement room(dungeon) so stuffy we had to risk rats and leave window open - no natural light. smallest room I have ever seen. Dirty bedcovers, dirty toilet, shower would not turn off - floor wet all the time. Coffee making facilities not replenished every day - towels changed after 2 days - 3 taken away only 2 left (for 3 people). An absolute disgrace - my email complaint ignored

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean!”
Reviews.Author: nadja189852
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights, and had read a lot of the reviews here before booking and was therefore not expecting much. Our room was a perfectly good size for two people with luggage. The carpet felt very clean, so did the beds and the room in general. The linen felt fresh and practically brand new! And the beds were really comfortable. The bathroom was also good, no problem with the water temperature or pressure. We tried the breakfast once, and highly recommend any travelers to go somewhere else for breakfast - there's a bunch of good restaurants and cafÃ©s just up the street. The room was a bit hot, but sleeping with the window open was just fine. The only thing I was a bit unhappy with was that I had booked a double room, but received a twin. Apparently you have to make some sort of extra request for a double bed.. Anyway, when we complained about this they told us in a friendly and helpful way that we would have to wait to the next day to be able to change rooms, but since we were only staying 2 nights we decided it wasn't worth the bother.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy78664
Reviews.Content: Complaints: Room service did not change out the towels Room was up a small flight of stairs that was very tricky to maneuver our bags through Shower temperature was very difficult to control at times, wild swings of very hot and very cold The floor sloped, so did the beds Breakfast was pretty lackluster, avoid the lunch meat and cheese selection, after that its basically toast and cereal The lift often didn't work, so 4th floor was fun. No TV remote Pros: Very close to Paddington station and lots of places to eat Decent price (Hotwire) Room was spacious enough

Reviews.Title: “Skip the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ChrystelSG
Reviews.Content: The service wasn't very good, I must admit. Alexandra hotel has different building and the guy at the desk wouldn't tell me which building my room was in. I had to drag him outside for him to point at the building! He pointed a building, N*10, which was under renovation. I had to on to the top floor. On the hotel's homepage, it was written that the hotel had an elevator. Really? No. I had 2 luggages, that I had to carry on my own to the top floor and the stairs are so tiny...My room was clean and huge, I asked for a single and got a double. That's the only plus. The changed towels and linen quite often, that's also a plus. Besides that, I couldn't sleep, people party on the stairs (weirdly) and it was impossible to call the desk...for there is no connection between the building and the desk. Amazing. Every morning at 7 I was woken by some men at my window, because of the renovation. I went to the desk and asked them to speak to those men, as it's no fun when you are woken up by strangers looking at you and saying "hello love"...When I had to check out, I asked to put my luggage in the luggage room as I was to leave after 4 hours. When I came back my luggage was behind the entry door. Anyone could have taken it.

Reviews.Title: “Normal, Basic breakfast, great location”
Reviews.Author: sofizitah
Reviews.Content: The room was small but ok. Clean. Near Paddignton Station. Surrounded by restaurants and bars. Could be cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Not suitable for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: Linden06
Reviews.Content: Would have been OK for a night's stay, but we were here for 4 nights in a twin room (no romance) with two larges suitcases in minimal floor space. Room was on the top floor and the floor sloped so badly that the bed sloping away from the wall was awkward to stay in. The bedding was clean. The bathroom was tiny, but adequate. More annoyed with our travel agent for even offering this accommodation for our length of stay, so will be having words with them on our return. Location is good for getting about.

Reviews.Title: “Twin rooms far to small, expensive WiFi & lax security.”
Reviews.Author: Emmahawk
Reviews.Content: Left valuables with clerk at desk as recommended in 'room guide' but found next day that they had not been put in the safe, but were still on the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy guests partying on the hallway”
Reviews.Author: karlalopez
Reviews.Content: Really small bedrooms, not so clean and pretty noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service and period blood stained sheets...”
Reviews.Author: leadyb
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner booked into the alexandra hotel for 2 nights. We wanted somewhere basic where we could rest our heads in a clean room. Booking in we were told we were not in the alexandra but the seymour hotel a few minutes up the road. This was fine by us, but arriving here we were told we were in the 'white house hotel' around the corner, and breakfast was in the basement of the seymour hotel. When we got into the room it was not like the internet photos of a clean and very basic room, it was basic with a bathroom like that of a caravan, still fine. But the sheets were covered in period blood, the bed had not been changed since the previous guests stayed there and the room smelled awful. We complained to the receptionist who, after 15minutes could not even remembered we had checked in with him! Room is unsanitary and location is okay, but for a couple quid more we got the kings cross travel lodge (there is two we got the cheapest) which was basic but clean!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, not fit for animals!”
Reviews.Author: heighington12
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Alexandra hotel with my sister, and having seen some photographs on the internet, was quite confident of a clean, if basic hotel. The reception area was average however when we were given the key to number 10, situated across the road, I was horrified! The hotel was being supported with scaffolding, and this was not limited to the outside. We negotiated 6 flights of stairs up a filthy, dingy and ripped stairway and let ourselves in to a cramped, smelly, filthy room with dirty carpets, even dirtier bathroom and a window sill with peeling paint that doubled as a head board. The beds looked dirtier than the carpet and had evidence of bed bugs or similar sharing the accomodation. I complained to reception who offered me another room. This was equally as filthy, and only had one bed. I would rather have slept on the floor anyway. I checked out of the hotel after refusing to view another room. I asked for my money back and am still waiting to hear from totalstay.com. I did go back to the hotel the next day, to take photos for evidence. My advise, do not put one foot in this hell hole!

Reviews.Title: “Potential customers beware!! You will stay here because of the hotel's location not it's amenities!”
Reviews.Author: GJ82_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexandra Hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is basic but serviceable; we booked through a 'compare the market' type website and were pleased to see that the hotel had a lift which would help as I have a bad back. However the room we were allocated was on the second floor of a section of the hotel which did not have lift access, leaving us to scale 4 flights of stairs to reach the room which made returning back after an evening out similar to scaling Mount Kilimanjaro! The room was small (twin room) but servicable, however it was not up to my level of cleanliness as under the beds had not been cleaned thoroughly as I discovered when storing my case there until I needed to re-pack to leave. Our en-suite bathroom was tiny however, as its design was like a 'pod' wetroom where despite having a showering area with a curtain everything got wet regardless of how much I tried to avoid this happening. The shower area is pathetically small and it is impossible to sit on the toilet without your knees touching the door, once ensconced inside the shower room (which is no mean feat in itself!) it is very difficult to manouvre from the toilet to wash your hands without falling into the shower area, a particular nuisance when every surface is still wet after someone has a shower. The breakfast is stated as 'continental' - the breakfast we received is not one I would class in this manner. There are two cereals (corn flakes or rice crispies), slices of reconstituted ham, cheese and chicken, white bread toast, tea or coffee and very very cheap tasting orange juice with two yogurt pots at each table. The staff on hand in the basement restaurant (which is reached by a very steep staircase with low headroom) were very rude when asked a question, and would only answer any question with a yes or no. I questioned whether it was possible to have some brown bread as I am unable to each white bread but was given a monosyllabic 'no'. I must admit that by our last day we skipped the breakfast altogether and ate at a steakhouse restaurant opposite to Paddington station which offered a full english breakfast which was delicious - I feel that the hotel should take heed of this and offer such a service instead of their current meagre offering. Would I stay here again? No. However the location is very convenient and there are many, many other hotels along Sussex Gardens to chose from so I would recommend looking into those before considering the Alexandra Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if it's just a bed you want - no comforts”
Reviews.Author: Elderlybrother
Reviews.Content: The place was adequate, just. I booked a double room and was given a twin. The room was classed as en-suite, which it was, however, I have never seen a smaller bathroom in my life. When I sat on the loo, my knees rubbed against the door and I am not that tall. The shower was far too powerful and flooded the bathroom. A nightmare. There was no remote for the TV and on enquiring, I was told I had to pay Â£10 deposit for it!! When I got the TV working there was just a very poor snowy picture with 3 channels and no satelite TV as stated in the hotel blurb.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Denverites
Reviews.Content: Looked Ok on the net, but truly awful. We called our room the dungeon. Only room in the basement, right by the "dining room". Only window was a window well, no screen. Hot room.Drunks outside window at night. Sink the size of a shoe box. No other available rooms. Charged 20 pound deposit for tv remote control. For 94 pounds a night I felt completely ripped off. Rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “" Well we had a great time " Alexandra”
Reviews.Author: looby101
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a Friday to Monday long weekend with my teen daughter... i just wanted to put my two penny worth in. We were greeted by a very nice man on reception who was very helpful with advise on trips and so forth..... and was pleasant and charming to us both at all times. Our room was in the basement which was very nice , beds comfy....shower hot and powerful...... clean towels ever day...AND THEY WERE...even though we did not expect this. The hotel is only a stones throw from the station..... and is ideally situated for all the West End has to offer. My only little gripe is that the breakfast could have been a bit more interesting....... more cereals...ie museli and weetabix would have been nice...and the orange juice was a bit ugh. The scaffolding is there....... but why on earth is this causing people problems......its on the outside...not in your rooms. And yes when we come and visit this fine city again........ we will definatly be coming back to stay....thank you ....: )

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Diamondee2
Reviews.Content: Booked into Alexandra House and was told by a staff member who was clearly used to unhappy customers that we would be staying in sister hotel, The Seymour, so had to walk to tatty hotel with indifferent staff where other travellers were experiencing the same problem. We were given our key only to be told that our room was in a third hotel around the corner again where there were no staff as we had a main door key which had to be left at the second of the three hotels. The room was tiny, overlooking the back although we were told it would overlook the square at the front and the bathroom was 'capsule' style where the shower curtain overhung the toilet and was actually a very small wet room no larger than a train loo. We were given the option to move to our original room booking for the second night but were not able to see the room before 10.30am and would not be able to check-in until 3.30pm that afternoon, so declined the offer as we were not prepared to take the room without viewing and did not want to carry our luggage around till the check-in time. We looked at the dining room in the basement 5mins prior to it opening where we we shouted at by the staff for arriving early, but the brief glance told us all we needed to know, so we opted to decline the 'complimentary breakfast' and ate in one of the many local corner cafes. Never again! What a shame foreign travellers have to witness this side of out beautiful capital city.

Reviews.Title: “very good location but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: selibor
Reviews.Content: advantages: very good location, clean rooms, nice guys in reception disadvantages: very small rooms and unbelievable small bathroom, the brackfast is everyday similar but not so bad, no elevator (only in central stage)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - unless you like rodents and bed-bugs!”
Reviews.Author: N_IrelandBubble
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aleaxandra for a week in June 2010. Building being held up by scaffolding - very disappointing. The first room we were allocated was on the top floor - no lift, filthy stairs and a mouse came running from the room to greet us! Alternative room we were allocated was very poorly decorated, little storage space, the shower in the bathroom was very small and the bathroom wasn't exactly sparkling clean! We decided to make the most of things as we would be spending little time in the hotel but we felt this was more like a hostel than a hotel. Location was good, there was plenty of hot water and the tv was good (you need to hire the remote control but we worked out how to use it without the remote). Breakfast was dreadful - orange coloured water, bread not fresh, processed cheese and wilting cooked ham. We didn't bother again! As the week went on I developed a rash on my arms which I put down to maybe having been bitten by an insect in the zoo or one of the parks. By the day we were leaving the rash had spread to my legs, feet, stomach and back. My husband pulled back the sheets on my bed and we found lots of little blood splatters on the sheets - bed bugs! We had also noticed that the bath towels were not being changed, just folded to give the impression of being changed. The waste bin in the bathroom wasn't emptied for 3 days! An awful hotel - our written complaints have been repeatedly ignored (we had paid upfront after booking online so we never expected to get anywhere). Paid Â£483 for the week - dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Hotel don't think it lives up to 3 star rating!”
Reviews.Author: Polly3330
Reviews.Content: Room very small and dull, sheets too small for bed, bathroom very small not very clean, continental breakfast was very poor worst I have ever had, watered down Orange Juice!!! Breakfast staff not very friendly but reception staff were very nice. Elavator very danderous closed on me as I was exiting!! Convient Location for Paddington tube station a good selection of restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Booked Alexandra but were put in different hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosaburn
Reviews.Content: Spent a lot of time online checking hotel reviews before choosing the Alexandra Hotel. However, when we checked in we were told we were bing placed in a sister hotel, the Seymour. It was pretty awful. Reading the Tripadvisor reports on the Seymour there is no way I would have booked in to this hotel. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor accommodations”
Reviews.Author: writerbirder
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel's good points: It's just two blocks from Paddington Station and two Paddington tube stops. On the blocks between the hotel and the train station are numerous restaurants, cafes, and sandwich shops offering varying types of cuisine, plus convenience stores galore, and at least one Internet cafe. In the other direction, it's just a few blocks to Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens. A 15-minute walk through nearby Hyde Park will get you to the Royal Albert Hall. Unfortunately, the hotel itself is an abomination. You know you're in trouble when you realize that it's the only hotel on Sussex Place (the street is not Sussex Gardens, by the way, no matter what they say!) completely encased in scaffolding. And not just the main building, but the annex down the block, too. The scaffolding does facilitate recognition of the hotel from a distance, but there doesn't seem to be any actual construction or remodeling going on... except in a room off the lobby, next to where the only pay phone is. So if you need to use the pay phone during working hours, you won't be able to actually carry on a conversation with the person on the other end. The reason you will need a pay phone is that the room phones (at least the ones in the annex) can't be used to make outside calls! I don't mean that outside calls are prohibited, but that the phones just can't do it. Something to do with the wiring, or perhaps the nonexistent construction. You can call the front desk, and the clerk is always pleasant, and will even arrange for you to get additional pillows, but if you need a wake-up call, the reliability rating goes way down. Two mornings in a row, we had to wake up early for bus tours. The first morning, we got our call. The second morning, we didn't. Through some quirk of fate, I woke up with a half an hour to spare; we rolled out of bed, ran down the street and miraculously met up with our bus. The third time we needed a wake-up call, the clerk promised to knock on our door, because he suspected that there was something wrong with our phone. He knocked on our door 21 minutes late. Speaking of our door, it was one flight up in the annex. The room was very small, and so was the bathroom. The weather? Unseasonably warm. The air conditioning? What air conditioning? The window (without screen) opened onto some sort of concrete veranda, access to which could only be gained through a locked door on the stairway landing, so I supposed we were safe from an intrusion through the window if we needed to leave it open at night. Thankfully, I was right, even though an occasional construction worker did spend time during the day, including early morning hours, out on the veranda to smoke, guzzle a soft drink, and eat a bag of chips. The beds were quite comfortable. Remarkably, the room offered cabinet and closet space that was a notch above deficient. As for amenities, no facial tissues could be found (we had to buy our own), and, while the TV was an attractive flat screen sort that worked very nicely, we would have had to pay the hotel 10 pounds for a remote! So we didn't. A hair drier was hooked up to the wall, though- one of the few "perks," if you will, that the hotel provided. We decided to skip the advertised free breakfast, which consisted of a few slices of cheese and ham (not good if you're a vegetarian), bread, and cold cereal. But since there were so many places to eat within a couple of blocks of the hotel, this didn't really matter. No, I don't recommend this hotel. If all you care about is location and nothing else, then it's for you. Otherwise, I urge you to look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel fab location but”
Reviews.Author: becstarz
Reviews.Content: We ended up here as our original hotel had been over booked. It is currently being renovated but we weren't disturbed and all the fire routes were clear. Good price friendly guy on reception only he walked away when i tried to tell him there were little red bugs eating me in the morning when i woke up! Didn't eat breakfast went to Garfunkels up the road as we slept in a bit. Bathrooms were clean and towels were provided all in all not a bad stay just a minor bed bug problem

Reviews.Title: “great hotel better than expected”
Reviews.Author: annwooly
Reviews.Content: great hotel excellent value.ignore all the negative feedback.this hotel provided all we required good location,spotless and comfortable beds and enjoyable breakfast.some restoration work taking place but nothing to worry about.we would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Gungerdin
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel having read a mixture of mainly very average to poor reviews. Imagine my surprise when my double room had an extra single in it, a flat screen TV, tea & coffee making facilities & actually not a bad sized bathroom with a shower, that although connected to the bath taps was pretty good power, so a decent shower could be had. Towels & bedding were fresh & clean & though you don't get a selection of shampoo & shower washes, there was a collection of packaged soaps & plenty of extra toilet rolls. The location is superb for the tube & loads of eateries around. The hotel has a 24hr reception desk & though we didn't stay around for the 'continental' breakfast, it's a bonus that you could have at least had a little something before you left! I booked through hotelsclick.com & only paid Â£40.50 & have to say, it was very good value. Had I paid for a 4 star hotel, I would have expected all the trimmings, but, for what we paid, it was very reasonable & actually far better than a lot of the reviews had lead me to expect. It's not the Ritz but, for a central London hotel at this price......no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “No qality measure has been ignored in the search for generating a profit, the result is a terrible customer experience.”
Reviews.Author: PoozleEngland
Reviews.Content: Read the other reviews - they say it all. There are rooms spread up and down the street and the buildings are building sites with materials strewn on the stairways. The tiled entrance to the hotel showed it had once been an hotel of some quality. One step on to the dirty stair carpet showed that all further vestiges of this ditinguished past have been eradicated. The rooms are tiny, the sheets were too small for the bed, the food and drink offered for breakfast were very poor in quality and range, and they and the room beverages appeared to come from one of the cheapest sources in the UK. The prices show that huge profits are being made, none of which seems to be reinvested in customer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: eddiespain
Reviews.Content: tiny rooms, you canÂ´t hardly move in the shower, no gel, no shampoo, cold room, you need to pay for the TV remote control. An absolute disaster. The only good thing is outside the hotel: the location. DonÂ´t waste your time and money here.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Room, Pleasant Stay - Would Go Back”
Reviews.Author: mbeemerboy
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel within a few minutes of Paddington station - booked through lastminute.com. I found the staff helpful on reception, check in took about 5 minutes. The room was on the third floor, with two single beds, wardrobe and flat screen TV. Coffee and Tea making facilities and it had a hair dryer that worked were provided. It was the worlds smallest bathroom but then again you're normally on in it for a few minutes. Everything worked and there was plenty of hot water. In summary, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the towels were white and there was nothing left under the bed. I paid Â£52 to stay and I would go again at this price. If you want cheap and cheerful and no frills this hotel should be ok for you.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Alexandra”
Reviews.Author: VikingsNorway
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely a big joke. The desk clerk were presumptuous and did not even care to help us. The breakfast was a joke, tasted like nothing. Our room was in the basement, with view to the garbage area. The bathroom were so small that when you were talking a shower you had to go out of the room to turn around. The bedclothes and curtains were dirty. The radiator heater was set to max and it could not be turned down. We had to keep the door and window open to keep the temperature down to normal. We asked the desk clerk three times on two different days if they could turn off the radiator and got the same answer every time: No problem, tomorrow we will fix it. On the evening we got back to our hotel room and the temperature was 35 C. My wife went up and talked to the desk clerk and got the same answer: tomorrow. I got mad and asked the clerk if i had to go out and buy me an adjustable wrench, and the desk clerk replied, YES. To solve the problem i talked to another couple that lived at the hotel and on their radiator there was a knob to turn down the heat. I borrowed it and the problem was fixed. The best thing with this hotel were LEAVING IT DO NOT STAY HERE. If you do, it will be you that write the next review.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but the room is a tiny box!”
Reviews.Author: Breezy82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good if you are ONLY in the room to sleep. The price is great for the location but you certainly get what you paid for. Only the beds fit in the room and if you get a bathroom (I don't think all of them have bathrooms), you may not have room to close the door when you sit on the toilet! The shower is about 3 feet big and runs into the toilet- my husband barely fit in there! BUT at least there is a shower and the hotel is about a 3 minute walk from the metro (tube) station and to Hyde Park. The breakfast that's included is toast and cereal.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: pcmal
Reviews.Content: travelled to the uk from australia spent 3 nights in london from check in to check out no body from the hotel gave a stuff could hear every one in room above and beside us thumping around all night towels replaced every 2 days bed was uncomfortable i wont go on did not expect 5 star but i did expect to sleep in a clean room

Reviews.Title: “This place should be shut down”
Reviews.Author: HonestTraveller77
Reviews.Content: Flew to London from Ireland to see a show at the theatre and booked into the Alexandra for an overnight stay. On arrival to the hotel they were over booked and sent us across the road to their partnering Hotel, â€œSeymour Hotelâ€�. Checked in their and were sent to a room not even in the same building but down the street we could find the entrance. The room was terrible. It was in a basement right beside the dinning room. The bathroom was a port-aloo inside the bed room with a shower curtain diving the toilet bowel and shower. Thought that I would make myself a cup of coffee after the stress of the arrival and found that the milk was out of date. Woke up the next morning with the noise of people in the dinning room and also to find a few flee bites on me and my fiancÃ©e. Went for breakfast in the "dining room", it was continent and disgusting. The cheese was stuck to the plate. I know i didn't get to stay in the Alexandra, but this is how they treat you. THIS PLACE SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN

Reviews.Title: “Fit for Purpose”
Reviews.Author: Streaky_9
Reviews.Content: I was attending a function at the Royal Lancaster and decided to stay overnight in London rather than get an expensive Taxi home late at night. Got a good deal on last minute.com for the Alexandra which is about 100 mtrs away from the Royal Lancaster. Hotel room was small, bathroom v small, but clean comfortable and ideal for what I needed. Didn't try breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bking10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the London Paddington area before, and there are nicer hotels than this one for similar prices. The staff was disinterested or absent. The rooms were small and the bathrooms smaller (even by London "cheap hotel" standards, this was small !) The free breakfast was not worth the price. The common areas (hallways, stairs, breakfast area) were in bad shape. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “small room basic on frills”
Reviews.Author: ywen
Reviews.Content: no frills budget hotel adequete room small bathroom ,clean

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell. Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: jolyon39
Reviews.Content: Alexandra Hotel, 159 Sussex Gardens. The only good thing we encountered was the location. Here are some of the issues: 1. Shower in room smashed 2. Got stuck in the lift (Looks like a frequent occurence) 3. Staff do not care at all, totally disinterested in customers and treat you like vermin 4. Charged me for a simple tourist map of the area (Cheap) 5. The food at breakfast was the cheapest quality I have seen. 6. Bathroom dirty, actually had slime in it 7. Linen stained, bed worn out, sagging and lumpy 8. Furniture just old, dirty and dusty 9. Rooms noisy from either road or other guests (No sound proofing of any sort) 10. I could go on and on, this was a truly terrible experience Arrived from Hong Kong Jet lagged and found that the shower head in the room was smashed. Offered to move us but we were too tired, they agreed to shift us to a new room the next day which we did. Refused to fix the shower (No bath in the room) because no one to fix it on a sunday (rubbish, they were too cheap to get a plumber in the weekend) Hotel was full so they cleaned the room and gave it to another unsuspecting customer on Sunday night knowing the room had no washing facilities. When stuck in lift we pried the door open and climbed up and out and onto the floor above. Staff not even interested, when I went to the front desk the sole charge staff member just said oh...ok, I have re set it. (clearly knew how to reset the lift which implies to me that it is a common occurence and was not interested in customers experience.) Staff argue with customers eg. The lift and moving rooms. Another example was when I tried to enter the hotel via the front door on Sunday but it was blocked by someone on the front steps smoking and I had to sqeeze past him to get in. Turned out it was the front desk receptionist outside, smoking and making customers sqeeze past whilst he blew smoke at them. Charged me 1 pound for a simple map... I was jet lagged and too tired to argue but any other hotel would give it to you. Breakfast was a self serve affair. Available was: tastless white bread to toast, Jam, butter, pre sliced cheese that tasted nothing like cheese (must be the cheapest on the market) sliced ham (Real cheap stuff), cornflakes type cereal that was like chipped cardboard pieces (cheapest on market type of stuff), Heavily watered down orange juice..... need I say more??? Fantastic location but owners are cutting corners on maintenance, staff training, food quality and every other thing. Cutting costs to to a ludicrious level to maximise profit at customers expense. I felt totally ripped off. This is an aweful place. Liked â€” Very, very short walk from Paddington Station and Heathrow express

Reviews.Title: “Clean,cheap, good location - will use again”
Reviews.Author: lockers43
Reviews.Content: Clean,Cheap, good location.Will certainly use this hotel agaIn.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: DEBDIL
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews we were a bit worried, but what do people expect for 20 pounds each a night in central (ish) London? OK the room wasn't the largest ever but all we did was sleep in it, and it was spotlessly clean and the bed was comfy. Breakfast wasn't wonderful with watered-down orange juice but there was unlimited toast and cereal. The staff were helpful and let us leave our bags when we arrived at 8am. About 5 mins walk from Lancaster Gate tube, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad.... excellent location, decent price....”
Reviews.Author: gosia4
Reviews.Content: When describing this hotel, i wouldn't say fantastic or great or nice.... what I will say is that it was OK.... I'm glad I stayed there - for the price and location.... the negatives: the room wasn't as clean as I'd like (for example, it didn't appear that housekeeping had vacuumed the room as there was dust in the corners; the bathtub was kinda dingy around the edges; I had a hair of mine that dropped on the floor in the bathroom the first day and I didn't pick it up or move it on purpose, as a test - it was still there - all 4 days I was there) no fridge (would've been nice - I kept things out on the windowsill to keep them cool) no wi-fi (not a huge deal, but would've been awesome) the positives: elevator! Clean sheets and clean towels... lots of towels too... location, location, location... it's literally 3 minutes walk from Paddington - which will get you anywhere.... safe area - I did not feel at all unsafe walking back to the hotel at night alone (I mean, I'm always cautious and conscientious of my surroundings, but I never felt unsafe) I liked giving my key to the front desk every time I left - it was one less thing to keep track of. breakfast - included and plenty of it. Coffee, juice, toast, cereal, yogurt.... we filled up in the mornings and were able to skip a meal later, which saved us some money (I'm all about travelling on a budget - I'd rather spend money on activities than food). also, the kettle in the room was clean and there were clean cups provided every morning. I had stayed at another 2 star hotel for one night of my trip and that hotel was a bit cleaner and had a fridge (helpful for saving money on food and drink) but the location was worse. Overall, I'd stay there again. For the price and location mainly. i've heard horror stories about budget accomodations in London but this was not one of them. Don't be scared to stay there. It's OK. :)

Reviews.Title: “dont book this! DON'T!”
Reviews.Author: birtual
Reviews.Content: I cannot imagine what are they thinking when they charge such prices for this [--]! I slept there, and no bug bit me.... but common! the bathroom in a train might be way more adequate than the one we had in this room, it is a pity I didnt take a picture to show, because anything i can say will not be close to the shock i was in when i saw that bathroom. about the room, its was more less clean, so OK, that is the most important for me... but everything seems so old, the beds, the sheets, the bed cover... so old, with marks and stains. i didnt want to walk bare foot or touch the bed cover with any part of my body. small wardrobe, and small tv with no remote control

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: candi2008
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel as part of a Singapore Air "free nights" deal. We didn''t expect much given that it was a "freebie" and given some of the reviews we'd read, but the location was good and we had a fairly good idea what 2-star London hotels were like. Actually, it was fairly good. It is in a great location - a few minutes walk from Paddington (where Heathrow train arrives) and good bus routes , and close enough to walk to Hyde Park . The area also felt reasonably safe to us. Our room was very small - there were two single beds in it and barely enough room to walk between them to get to the (also very small) bathroom. But the beds were extremely comfortable, the shower was good, and there was basic tea/coffee making equipment. Breakfast was adequate, with plentiful cereal and toast. The staff didn't particularly go out of their way, but they weren't unhelpful. When we arrived at 8am they let us put our bags into the vacated but not yet cleaned room. I think others' comments about staff could be explained by the fact that this is certainly not a hotel with modern communications etc . We asked to leave our passports in the safe and handed over an envelope with them in ; when we retrieved them on the morning we left, the hotel receptionist appeared to lean under the counter and pick the envelope up off an open shelf , so we assume that's where they had been stored! The other incident occured when we decided we'd like to stay another couple of nights. We were due to leave on Monday morning and asked on the Saturday if there was a vacancy for the Mon & Tues nights . The reception staff couldn't tell us because the "office" was closed for the weekend - it seemed they had no way of knowing what bookings they had for the next few days. Their only suggestion was that we find an internet cafe and try to book online. (They apologised for the fact they didn't have any internet access at all in the hotel - not even for staff. ) All in all, we thought this was good value for money - providing you paid the hotel rate ... and here's where I'd add a word of warning. Singapore Air provided 2 free nights at the hotel as part of their airfare deal. But at this hotel, if you stay on a Friday or Saturday, you have to stay for 3 nights in total, so we had to pay for the 3rd night. The agency that managed the booking charged us the equivalent of 100 English pounds for one night for 2 people - but when we arrived at the hotel we found they would have charged us only 70 pounds (for either internet bookings or "walk ins") ! Would we stay there again? Yes - good location, basic comfortable room, and adequate breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: davo064
Reviews.Content: this is a good hotel.the location is good,close to public transport.the staff were very helpful and let us check in early.The rooms are a bit small but are clean.the breakfast is adequate.if like us you only use the room to sleep and shower,this is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Back breaking postage stamp”
Reviews.Author: Forever_a_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Cor! I couldn't believe it, but I was amazed when we were expected to carry the 67 year old aunt's heavy suitcase to the third floor room, up a winding staircase. The room was reasonably clean, but smaller than a postage stamp and the shower met the loo, due to lack of space. Breakfast was adequate, but nothing flash. The staff were helpful. It's the Travel Lodge or Travel Inn next time to save our backs and give us some room for the luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad little hotel”
Reviews.Author: shazm1
Reviews.Content: Our two nights were "free" as part of our travel package. Was a bit anxious to see what we would get based on some of the reviews I had seen. Our room had two single beds but that was something we could have sorted before we left but I had over looked that from our itinery. Overall the room was spacious enough and clean. The breakfast was ample but nothing spectacular. Staff were friendly and helped with getting us on one of the hop-on-hop-off bus tours (a must!!) The location is great as you are close to Paddington and there are plenty of eating options in the area. Steak houses seem to be popular. Post office close too. Not a bad experience at all.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel at the lovely Paddington”
Reviews.Author: lindsGent
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alexandra is a nice and small hotel in the heart of paddigton, londen. I have stayed there two nights and was happy with the room that i got. I read several reviews about this hotel and some of them were shocking. So i hoped for the best and i am satisfied. I got a nice cleaned room, with a small bathroom. The room had one large bed and one small, and i booked for two people. The room was clean and everything worked ( tv, coffemachine, hairdryer...) The bathroom was small, but cleaned good. The water in the shower was warm. So no complains. We couldn't check inn at 1O am but we left our luggage without any problem at the desk. The only thing that wasn't ok, was breakfast. The toast was hard to bite, there wasn'ty many choise , it was not good. And breakfast was done at 9.15. So no time to get out off bed late. We had a nice stay in the hotel. Because we were only three days in londen, the hotel was a nice place to sleep..... So hotel Alexandra wasn't so bad at all. And i advice the hotel to people who go on a citytrip like i did, it's location is great, only a couple of footsteps away from paddington station that brings you everywhere....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rem123sa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alexandra Hotel five days in March, 2008. I was a teacher/group leader for 32 students. The location was great - just a few minutes walk from Paddington Station, access to ATM machine, fast food, deli, pubs and an internet cafe, all within a two block radius. This is a budget hotel so your expectations should be reasonable. The room was acceptable- clean, bath area was small (shower only)-only soap was provided so bring your bath supplies. My students did have some "telephone" issues, but a pay phone was nearby, allowing them to use their telephone cards. Because of the "fast-paced" student tour, we spent very little time in our rooms, therefore the great location trumped any of the other inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice perhaps”
Reviews.Author: iteach64
Reviews.Content: I stayed with this hotel for one week with a large school group. The hotel is separated into two buildings. The rooms were clean but the annex lacked any phone service for the duration of our stay. The rooms were modestly appointed but did include working hair dryers, which was a pleasant surprise. Many rooms lacked heat. There is no lift in the annex building and many rooms were up 7 or 8 flights of steps. The breakfast was sparse but better than nothing. I would not classify the hotel staff as accommodating, in general; however, there was one individual who did carry some suitcases upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly a bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteBB
Reviews.Content: We picked the Alexandra Hotel because it was a Singapore Airlines' -stopover hotel, reasonably priced, and it was handy to a mainline station (Paddington). Sadly - it was extremely noisy (traffic noise day and night during the week) and service from front desk staff left a little to be desired. Breakfasts were good and location convenient. The main "gripe" we had was the difficulty in making telephone calls - we had problems with our mobile phone from home and needed to call our telco to sort them out. The telco's publicity was not clear, and we will take that matter up with them - however, hotel staff were unable to assist us by helping us to make a reverse- charge home for us when asked. (We paid the bill and this has now been refunded by our telco now we are home.) Otherwise service was fine. There was much less noise on Saturday and we had the thrill of a troup of horses and pillions being ridden down Sussex Gardens on Saturday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep with bugs”
Reviews.Author: Cristine24
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Alexandra hotel three nights, two nights with bugs, one night without them. I will never forget it. Hotels location was good, breakfast okay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there, they steal your stuff!”
Reviews.Author: An4
Reviews.Content: The first room I stayed in had twin beds (we asked for double and never got them) and a leaking roof! It kept me up all night! The bathroom was a disgrace. Very small in plastic, and every time you take a shower the whole 1m2 of the bathroom would get flooded. And it was very dirty. We also had no blankets in the room, just sheets. In the morning we asked to be transfered to a different room and we were. The other room was better, without the leaking roof, and it had a normal bathroom. Both rooms cost the same (I don't see how). The other day we got stuck in the elevator which doesn't function properly but nobody warned us! It is supposed to carry up to 4 people and the receptionist later yelled at us and cursed because he told us only 3 people fit in the elevator. We showed him the sign inside the elevator saying "4 persons". He didn't know what to say. The worst thing was - STEALING! Very conveniently, the day before our check out one of the bags with clothes we bought few days before disappeared! It was in the room for days, but just before you need to leave it's gone! There was no time for us to do anything and the police wouldn't even react to a stole bag of goods worth about 70 pouds. But it was worth to us, it had stuff for the kids, clothes and toys. We learned that also the day before, "someone" stole a laptop from one of the rooms. There were no signs of braking and entering. Someone knew what they were looking for and knew exactly where to find it. You are required to leave the key at the receptionist desk when you go out, so they know when you are not in the room. I wouldn't recommend Alexandra hotel to anyone! I could get over a lot of the things but not the fact that your personal things are not safe in your room and the management doesn't do anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “A mystery”
Reviews.Author: inna_stepanova
Reviews.Content: We were staying for 3 nights. We were supposed to be at Seymore hotel, but there was some floods and problems with the top rooms, so we were proposed to stay in Alexandra. The twin room was ok, but so tiny. The en-suite facilities were so small, to put it mildly. When you take a shower, the half of you is already in shower cabin, the other half is in toilet. We were shocked to find out bed-bugs in our beds and when we got home we saw traces of stings on our bodies. So now we have to cure ourselves. I am just praying not to bring to home those insects somewhere in my luggage. The breakfast was enough. Toasts, butter, jam, coffee, yoghurt. The stairs are so steep, but that's not a trouble when you do not have a heavy suitcase which you have to bring into the room which is on the 3rd floow. The location of the hotel is very successful. The main places of interest are reachable even by a few minutes walk. There is a subway station really very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!! A Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Campbellsoup
Reviews.Content: If we didn't laugh we would have cried. This room was worse than we could have ever imagined. We were originally booked at the Seymour Hotel and after arriving late in the evening from Istanbul and a two week cruise (very small insided cabin), we thought we were prepared for a small but clean room. Boy, the surprises never stopped. First we were sent walking to The Alexandra Hotel because a pipe broke and the rooms were damp :( They took our money and sent us on our way promising us that the rooms were bigger at the Alex than the Seymour so our deal was even better. At the Alex we were sent to the basement/dungeon via a very steep, narrow stairway with no railing. Finding a room about 8 x 10 with twin beds we tried to get moved but of course the hotel was sold out. The room had a large window that opened to a courtyard that accessed everyone elses large window. We felt free to help ourselves to anything from another room by walking out our window and enter theirs. There was no a/c so we locked our window and hoped we would live to tell our tale. The beds were 50 years old and had no support left. We had two bath towels, no hand towels, no wash cloths, three used bars of soap, three rolls of toilet paper sitting on a shelf, and a bathroom/shower combo that required us to leave the door open so we could fit. The note on the desk told us not to leave our towels on the floor because they were ours for the next two days, and the sheets would be changed after three days. Breakfast was the highlight - yogurt, cheese, ham and toast. Not bad. Beware. The price was low, but the accomodations were awful. We were glad we brought earplugs and sleeping pills.

Reviews.Title: “No rest at all”
Reviews.Author: Will de d
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Alexandra Hotel for five nights from September 7 to September 12, 2007, booking to hotel through gtahotels. The room and bathroom were very small, but that is to be expected in a two star hotel in London. The breakfast was adequate, but served in room where you coudn't swing a cat. The worst part was the noise. We were send to an anex (number 10) and this was an old house with no isolation at all. All night long you could here fire doors slamming shut when other guests arrived or went out, people talking in the corridor or their rooms and when someone walked up the staircase, it was like the ceiling coming down. The room was so hot and the room so small that there was a lack of oxygene after spending only one or two hours in it and in it was impossible to keep the windows shut. But leaving them open, meant that the noise got even worse. After five nights, we were completely exhausted by lack of sleep. If you want an hotel to rest after exploring London, stay away from the Alexandra. It may be at a central location, but is isn't worth paying GBP 70 a night for a small and noisy dump.

Reviews.Title: “A real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller25
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room and the beds were tiny, as was the bathroom. There was no space for our two suitcases. The room was filthy, stains down the walls and carpet under the bed which had never been vacummed. The breakfast left a lot to be desired, the hotel must have been fully booked because we could not get a table. When we did get a table, the only item on the 'buffet' that looked apertising was the toast. In terms of location, the noise was terrible and the lack of airconditioning in the room made sleeping in the summer heat very difficult. I would not recommend this to anyone for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel But Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: anok4u2
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed clean, staff were friendly enough. Room was basic but good for the price. Breakfast was good. The only trouble with this place were bed bugs. The beds were riddled with them & I could not sleep at night knowing this. It ruined our holiday really. I would definitely not stay there again which is a shame because the hotel was very good for a budget price & was ideally located for Paddington station.

HotelInfo.Name: Alexandra Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Sussex Place | Hyde Park, London W2 2RY, England
